Catalog Sales app needs to be able to read the input data as well as to save and read taken orders. The permission to read and write to storage is needed for the app to function.

"Catalog Sales" is an Android app used by sales representatives. 

If you are a company wanting to proudly offer your products to your customers, then this app is a prefect vehicle for you to showcase your products professionally and to take orders in an efficient and automated way - eliminate those regular human errors and replace manual entering of hand taken orders.

In order to use this app, it is necessary to populate it with the relevant information for your products. 

Data needs to be provided in tabular form with two separate tables: one for customer data and one for product data. 

Following are relevant customer data columns: 
 * customer name column - used for taking and saving orders; 
 * id/code column - unique identifier for identifying each customer. This can be a separate column like customer code, or you can make some other column an id column, such as customer name. Entries for each customer in this column need to be unique. 

The following columns are relevant for products data: 
 * product name column - displayed in details screen as a title; 
 * image name column - used to match a product with its image (includes file extension: e.g. product1.jpg); 
 * id/code column - unique identifier for identifying each product. This can be a separate column like product code, or you can make some other column an id column, such as product name or image name. Entries for each product in this column need to be unique. 
 * price column - if you want to display price when displaying products, or to show total order price, you need to provide a price column. It needs to be in decimal (real) format, without currency sign (e.g 12.34) 
 * tax percentage column - containing integer values. If you want to display tax portion of the order, you need to provide this info in a separate column. 
 * pack size column - containing integer values. If omitted, it will be 1 for all products. 
 * active column - app provides control over which products to display. You can mark a product active/inactive (e.g. if its in/out of stock). If you want to preload which products to make inactive, you can provide a column with this info. Otherwise all are active. 
 * columns for grouping products - for selecting which products to display, for example product category, supplier, etc. You can add as many such columns as you need. 
 * Any other additional columns which will be displayed in details screen as info, such as description, barcode, country of origin, etc. 

Note: Column 'active' can only have two distinct values. E.g. Y and N, Yes and No, 1 and 0, and similar. 

If you have data in a database hosted online, you can provide it as an API with json output, by specifying the url. 

You can otherwise supply the data in csv format - from a csv file which can be hosted online - specify url, or locally - specify dir location on the device. 

It is easy to provide data for this app even if you don't have a database or you don't know how to provide Json output or how to host files online: any Excel table can be saved as a csv - file of comma separated values. Just put your data in an Excel sheet containing described columns. Save it as a csv file, copy this file to the device and specify the location of the directory where you have put it. 

As product images can be shown in a grid, you can supply the images of your products. You can either copy the images to your device and specify the local dir where you have copied them, or specify url if images are hosted online. If you are hosting images online, please make sure they are minimized. 

If you don't provide the images, the product names will be used to showcase products in a grid. It is recommended to provide the product images as this makes the app look and feel much more professional and is necessary if you want to use it as a catalog to proudly showcase your products. 

If data is pre-loaded for you by the developer you can click skip to load it into the app. Otherwise, to specify the formats and locations of the above described information (these can be changed later from 'Load' and 'Main Columns' settings), click continue.
